result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephen T Hink was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephen T Hink

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Becca. 
Case Called: 2:31 pm. 

State appears by ADA Ben Vechinski. 
Defendant Stephen Hink appears in person and with Attorney Dave Casey.

VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. 
State moves to: Ct. 1 (Battery / Domestic Abuse) >> DRI.  COURT GRANTS. 

PLEA: Ct. 2 (Disorderly Conduct / Domestic Abuse) >> NO CONTEST. 

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

Parties move forward with argued sentencing. 
Statement and arguments by ADA Vechinski and Atty Casey.

COURT ORDERS: 60 days jail; to report w/in 45 days. Court Costs. Court grants 30 days to pay. Domestic Violence surcharge. Court finds 1 day credit.

Adjourned: 3:00 pm.
Character Letter from H.H., w/cover letter
Plea hearing on October 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
